Black Mountain Elementary School's amazing fourth grade teachers used Project Based Learning to provide authentic learning experiences for their students. With the use of penpalschools.com, students completed projects and interacted with students from around the world. The students learned about the science behind COVID, how people have been affected around the world, and about frontline workers.

As a part of the experience, students were able to choose a project to either show support for frontline workers or share their learning with others. They could complete the task in any platform of their choosing but were challenged to reach as many people as possible.

It is always fun to see how kids respond to the challenges presented in Project Based Learning. For this experience, some students posted posters in their yards, some took flyers to a hospital, while others made cookies and signs for the local fire department. (Alannah raised $76.78 to donate plants for the nurse stations at the mayo hospital.) BOBCAT PRIDE - #WeAreCCUSD

CCUSD COMMUNITY: Please be aware of recent "robo-calls" from what looks like a local phone number in the CCUSD range (480-575-2XXX). The message states that your Apple ID has been compromised and asks that you stay on the phone to be connected to an agent that will help you resolve the issue. This is an obvious Phishing SCAM designed to steal your personal information.

You should not take unsolicited calls from anyone you do not expect to be calling you. Never share your personal information via telephone or email if you did not initiate the contact, and know the person, and the reason for the contact.

New Wifi Map and Free Tech Support Hot Line Launches to help Arizona students access internet via open hotspots for virtual learning

As schools begin online instruction this month, a coalition of statewide organizations realized that 200,000 Arizona families will struggle to access internet with enough bandwidth to facilitate virtual instruction.

In collaboration with the AZ State Library, School Connect, Common Sense Media, the Commerce Authority and the AZ Broadband Stakeholder Network, our Connect Arizona website provides an interactive map of Free Wifi spots across the state (public libraries, schools, internet providers, community organizations).

This web site is available in English and Spanish and provides:
Easy access on mobile phones
Simple training on how to access a hotspot
Free Tech Support phone line by Arizona public library staff (AZ LibTAP)
Special discounts provided by Arizona internet providers
Google Map with step by step directions to get to these free WiFi spots.

https://sites.google.com/view/azlibtap/home

It is with deep regret that we must pull the option of the voluntary COVID-19 testing by Spector Labs. It has come to our attention that while there is no upfront charge to individuals, Spector Labs would be charging insurance companies. This was not made clear during our discussion with the Lab.

We miss our students and are hoping that September 8th is a viable return date. Thank you for listening.

post_text: THANK YOU Afterschool Professionals!
shared_text:
ECS - Education and Community Services Cave Creek is feeling proud.
April 23 at 7:41 PM ·

LETS CELEBRATE KIDS CLUB!

Afterschool Professionals Appreciation Week is a time to recognize and appreciate those who work with youth during out-of-school hours.

Afterschool Professionals are skilled individuals who work with children and youth in diverse school and community-based settings to provide a wide variety of positive developmental relationships and experiences during out-of-school hours. Currently in the U.S., an estimated 850,000 individuals are practicing members of the afterschool profession.

An estimated 10.2 million children participate in afterschool programs each year, and for every child in an afterschool program there are two more waiting to get in. Every young person deserves quality afterschool experiences that positively impact their development. It takes skilled professionals to create these experiences.

Because of the important role afterschool professionals play in the lives of kids, they deserve recognition and support!

#heartofafterschool

Thank you for all you do!!!

If you know one of these ladies, Please send a shout out to them!!!
